You're just so LAZY! Is it that hard to just drag'n drop?
amarius1, I will be busy in the following week (no posting for me) and I will tempoarily not be able to work on EVE configs. Also, I can't seem to get the Daphy fog to show up.

Well, doing drag and drop for about 20 mods, all with varying zip file structures, manually checking whether all depends are installed or whether maybe two conflicting versions of a depend got auto-installed, and manually checking the forum threads of all of my mods for updates gets tedious quite fast.

yup, that is one of the main reasons to use <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr> for me - I have around 60 mods currently installed..

btw. just tryed to install this mod with <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr>. got a 404.

Shouldn't this link to your github? (should be easy to setup)

[https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/NetKAN/blob/master/NetKAN/KerbolPlus.netkan](https://github.com/KSP-CKAN/NetKAN/blob/master/NetKAN/KerbolPlus.netkan)

But for some reason the mod was deleted on KerbalStuff.

Kerbal Stuff stopped me and amarius uploading updates, therefore it isn't used anymore. When kopernicus updates to 0.0.7 ckan can be a possibility but for now only OPM uses it.

why is the latest release v.2.0.5, when there is already a 2.0.6?

That just makes it harder to create a ckan config for this mod..

Edit:

Please mark the "v.2.0.5" as an release. The github api believes that it is a prerelease.

Currently working on a .netkan.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-30T14:30:37Z" title="05/30/2015 02:30  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 30, 2015</time> by Postremus**

Thank you. But I am very new to github so I don't inow why it still uses a useless commit even trough 2.0.5 in latest release in "releases" section!

Looked into the netkan source, found something interesting.

Netkan checks [https://api.github.com/repos/Amarius1/Kerbol-Plus/releases](https://api.github.com/repos/Amarius1/Kerbol-Plus/releases) to get the latest releases.

It picks the first one of this list of releases, which is no prerelease.

The list is ordered by the creation date of the release, not by the publish date.

2.0.6 is picked because it is the first one on that list.

Posible solution would be either:

A) Renaming the releases, and changing the downloads accordingly

![B)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_cool.png) Delete all releases, and recreate them in the correct order

Solutions.. (sort of)
K. Will try. Also, on my side, only 2.0.5 is in tye releases part as "latest release".trying to fix...

jup, did a little test.

The latest release thing is only changed, when a new commit is pushed to the repository..

Edit: Netkan does not care about what is marked as latest release.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-06T20:52:39Z" title="06/06/2015 08:52  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 6, 2015</time> by Svm420**

Where did you get duna2.png used in your eve configs? I have tried all the major packs and i can not find any using this image. Without it no planets get clouds as eve glitches. Also you really should put your DOE and PS configs in your folder outside of the those mods main config files. Otherwise someone will probably end up overwriting the file when an update comes. Finally your config for planetshine needs to be updated to the newer node names as they conflict with DOE.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-06T22:44:43Z" title="06/06/2015 10:44  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 6, 2015</time> by Svm420**
